div.head:
Embleme 49. Of the Secrets of Nature.
The Philosophicall infant is, as Orion, the Sonne of three fathers.

lg.l: Vulcan with Hermes and Apollo did
Their seed inject into an oxes hide,
Whence produced was the great Orion:
Three fathers allso hath the Sophicke Sonne;
The Sunne is first, Vulcan the next is stil'd
The artist is third father of this Child.

div.head: Discourse 49.
div.ab:
Those women, which prostitute themselves to variety of men, doe sel
dome conceive lively children through the confusion of divers seeds:-
for nature in the generation of man and the most part of animalls ad
mitts noe superfætation, except perhaps very rarely: and therefore-
every offspring is produced from one onely father and mother, whether
it be one or more, as is allso manifest by historyes and the event of-
some supposing otherwise; in the first place of Margarett the wife of
Herman Earle of Henneberge, who, in the year 1276, brought forth
three hundred and sixty five children, which were all baptized,-
and the males called by the name of John, and the females Eliza
beth, their grave being dead is yet to be seen in the Church of Laus
dune, one mile distant from the Hague towards the Sea in Holland,
together with the brazen bason, in which they were baptized, and an
inscription of the story: The cause alleadyd was, that the Countesse,
seing a poor woman carry two children twinns in her armes, calld her
adulteresse, as if it was impossible for more children to be borne at one
conception by one man, but necessarily by severall: Whereupon an im
precation being made by the poor woman, who knew her selfe clear-
of that accusation, the Countesse conceived in her wombe at one time
and by one man soe many children, as there are dayes in the year:
This is indeed a miracle, but a naturall worke, which happened-
through the vengeance of God: But in the Philosophicall worke-
that, which is otherwise contrary to nature, is easily admitted under
the veyle of an allegory: For here one infant is sayd to have three fa
thers, or allso two, as allso mothers: Hereupon sayth Raymund cited by the-
Rosary; Our infant hath two fathers and two mothers, and because hee
with his whole substance is tenderly nourished in fire, hee therefore-
never dyes: Soe Dionysus or Bacchus is sayd to have two mothers, who-
was rip'd out of his mothers belly (being burned) before the time of his
maturity, and matured in his fathers thigh, soe that the father became
a mother: But these things are better declared in the conception of-
Orion, who is sayd to be produced from the seed of Apollo, Vulcan,-
and Mercury mixd together, and præservd in the hide of an Oxe for
the space of tenne moneths: These things would be alltogether monNBow
strous, not onely fabulous, if a secret of nature were not compre
hended under these shrouds, not obvious to all Men. Lully in the-
Theoricke of his Testament attributes to the same Philosophicall-
infant soe many and allmost the same fathers, namely Sol, who
is Apollo, or the cælestiall Sol is the first author of this generation,-
certaine matter knowne to the Philosophers, as upon the matrix-
Discourse 49.
of a woman, and therein produceth a Sonne or infant like to himselfe,
to whome afterwards hee will leave and resigne his armes and ensigns-
of virtues, by paternall right, that is, the faculty of maturing things im
mature, and the energy of tinging and purging things not tinged nor
purged. For whatsoever Sol is able to perfect in a thousand years, that
will his Sonne performe in halfe an houre; That therefore virtue-
may be made a thousand times stronger in him, than in Sol, his fa
ther delivers him to Vulcan and the Artist together for education, that-
his generous disposition may be polished and multiplyd in virtues by
their means; for manifest it is that to practice from a child conduceth
much: Soe Achilles, Jason, Hercules were comitted to Chiron to be in
